Reviews.Title: “The presidential suite is the way to go for a local romantic night!”
Reviews.Author: Amenis
Reviews.Content: I always stay in the presidential suite because of the awesome in room jaccuzi. It fits two people comfortably. It has a living room when you first walk in and then a cal king bed, two bathrooms, and an amazing jaccuzi. The breakfast is ok at best but the room totally makes up for it. The room is cheaper during the week. Just awesome. check it out!!

Reviews.Title: “BUGS! BUGS! BUGS!”
Reviews.Author: BuggsMcGoo
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an economical hotel for a week while I relocate to the area. Seemed like a good hotel for a reasonable price. The froint desk staff seemed polite and accomodating. Little did I know that when I woke up after the first night, there was blood on my sheets and two bed bugs were crawing around. Now, a couple of days later, I have welps on my arms, neck, and ankles. They did refund the unsed portion of my reservation, but I still had to pay for the night that I was a feast to these critters. This is GROSS! I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Visit”
Reviews.Author: wff5
Reviews.Content: Clean motel, free parking, nice breakfast, free business PC in lobby, convenient to most LA locations. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms clean but if you are a light sleeper stay away”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was ok, from reading previous reviews it had been updated recently. The room was clean and had enough space. The staff were incredibly helpful and delightful. The one big problem is the noise, the trains seemed to run until gone 11 and started up at around 8 am. It is not just the train going along the line they seem to toot their horn every time they go by the hotel as it sounds like there is a crossing and they warn people they are coming. It sounded like the train was about to enter our room it was that loud. Then you have the noise as people walk down the corridor, the walls are incredibly thin and you can hear suitcases being pulled along and people talking in the corridor. The breakfast was well stocked and maintained by the gentleman on the desk, there is limited space so the bacon and eggs are microwaved but there are lots of choices including a waffle machine. If you can cope with the noise then a perfectly pleasant hotel for the money but not for me. I would say don't leave your name and address if you make a comment on the comment card in the room, I went to leave a comment on the card only to discover that someone had completed it in march and it had still been sitting there in September, they obviously do not value their customers comments, thankfully that person had not left their address but it would be a little worrying if they had.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hosts, rooms OK. Bit noisy though.”
Reviews.Author: RoelR
Reviews.Content: We arrived here from LA to go to Six Flags Magic Mountain, which is about a 45mins drive. Checkin was fast and flawless. I needed to print our tickets to Six Flags on their computer, no problem! The rooms are of decent size and clean. Unfortunately it wasn't possible to make it dark enough for us, and there were lots of people running around at night, cheering and yelling (Nothing the hotel can do about). Breakfast was OK, but the breakfast room was too small, so we had to take ours to the room. Pool area was nice, with a (cold!) larger pool, and a hot spa. The railroad is closeby, so be prepared to hear some trains pass by regularly. There are lots of shops & restaurants within close range as well. We had a nice stay, but due to some ignorant people, not a perfect night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The non-smoking rooms have been smoked in. No Mac Internet Access”
Reviews.Author: busterzdad
Reviews.Content: They gave me two different non-smoking rooms, both had been smoked in. I stayed in the second one they offered because the smell wasn't as bad, and it was late and I was tired. But they have no signs or anything in the room to warn people not to smoke. And, there are ash trays and cigarette butts everywhere on the premises. If you are a non-smoker, bad place. I tried using my laptop with their wireless in my room, in the lobby, and then hooked up with a WAN cable in my room. It didn't work, they told me another Apple Mac user was having same problem. If you are a smoker with a PC, this place will work fine. if you are a non-smoker and / or have a Mac, and need to be online and to breathe, this is the wrong place. They were extremely nice, apologetic, and gave me a steeply discounted rate when I told them about the problem. So they have a good attitude and mean well. But non-smoking isn't a matter of degrees, it either is or it isn't. They need to get tough on this, and clean up the rooms that reek of year old tobacco.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: lovelle333
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!! Worst hotel stay ever. Parking is limited, small, and inadequate. If you are unable to get a spot you have to either park infront of the liquor store next door or the office complex with the lot hidden by large shrubs. We were given room 119 which welcomed us with an odor similar to urine and a bathroom with a softball size hole about the shower that collapsed into the tub and the smell of mold. Front desk responded with “okay” and didn’t look like they cared. The second, and last room available, was not cleaned well. We flipped the pillow cases inside out to find yellow spots and blood stains on one of the pillows. Room was loud and we could hear everything and a smoke detector beeped all night from low batteries. Original reservation was for two nights but we cancelled second night in morning. Checkout was a hassle. I was first charged for the original price I had booked the room ($99 a night) and once I was handed the receipt I told the employees there was supposed to be a note in my account saying I was being charged $84. It took two staff members to figure out how to reverse the transaction and charge me the right amount. I will never recommend a comfort inn stay after this

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Simi Valley, Reagan Library”
Reviews.Author: 1oldseagull
Reviews.Content: Nicely kept property, good breakfast. We appreciated being near our target for visit, yet out of the LA traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic (for the couple next door)”
Reviews.Author: JackKerowack
Reviews.Content: The soundproofing must not be so great because I woke up every time the very energetic couple next door made love -- which was at least four times during the late night and early morning. (Congratulations to them!) My room was non-smoking but there was a slight smell of smoke and I saw a trash receptacle full of butts on the public walkway outside the room. Metrolink trains pass by with horns blaring into the evening, but not overnight. But I am a train fan, so that was a plus for me. Staff people were very, very friendly and helpful. Breakfast bar in the morning looked inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: travelertoo2
Reviews.Content: There is a very active railroad crossing less than 300 feet away that accomodates freight, Amtrak and Metro-Link that basically runs 24/7. There is inadequate parking but "you can park in the lot next-door between 7:30 pm and 8:00 am but we are not responsible." Marquee touts re-modeled rooms but obviously our room was not included. The carpet was dirty, there were cigarette burns, three, in the comforter, and two on the sofa in a non-smoking room, the lamp shades were trashed, the wall paint is dirty and as an extra-added attraction the lid to the ice bucket was filthy as was the area around the coffee maker. If that isn't enough, the place is rated a 3-Diamond by AAA. So much for their rating system. (Oh wait that must fall under another review.)

Reviews.Title: “Room infested with Bees”
Reviews.Author: isithot
Reviews.Content: Staff very unprofessional. They first tried to put me in room # 120 in the alley with the trash. When I complained of the smell I was put into room # 328 which was infested with Bees. I have pics and witnesses to prove it. Front desk Clerk Said had the nerve to tell me I had an attitude. Needless to say I was forced to check out early and am disputing all charges. Went to the Howard Johnsons which was Paradise after the experience I had here. Will add my pics later when I get to my personal computer

Reviews.Title: “VERY UN-Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: BMWE34FAN
Reviews.Content: Ok ive rented rooms at Comfort Inns before. However they have never been this bad. The main sellgin point for me is supposed to be their CONTINENAL breakfast. There was nothing Continental about this hotel though. A few bear claws, some dried up croissants, cereal in Jars and a few slices of toast. Keep in mind that the parking lot was full and this was supposed to feed everyone. The room was OK. A/C was suffieient enough for 90 degree weather, however it was 108 this weekend so it needed improvement. Beds and SHowers not bad.
